titleStmt.title: Letter from Chancellor Burnett to Lt. Col. Jewett, January 3, 1929

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Letter from Chancellor Burnett to Lt. Col. Jewett, January 3, 1929
bibl.note: This image is a scan of a photocopy made from another unspecified collection. The letter should be located and rescanned when possible.

msIdentifier.repository: Archives & Special Collections, University of Nebraska-Lincoln Libraries
msIdentifier.collection: RG 570904 Donald A. Lentz and Gary R. Steffens, Marching Band Records

opener.salute:
Colonel F. F. Jewett
The University.
My dear Colonel Jewett:

div1.p: Replying to your favor of the 27th ult., in line with our conversation, I think the uniforms for the band should be maintained in good condition so that they make a good appearance. If it has been customary for the University to furnish such uniforms, I should say that this would be a legitimate item in your budget when making out the request for next year.
I think everyone recognizes that the band is a University institution and that the numbers need to present a good appearance. We cannot, of course, charge this up against them personally.

In the matter of a committee to raise funds by which the band may make trips with the football team or to represent the University, if upon consideration you think it advisable to appoint such a committee I should be glad to have you make recommendations as to the personnel of the committee.
